sen.j: 代銭納（だいせんのう）とは、中世日本の荘園・国衙領・武家領などにおいて、公事や年貢、地子などの納入を現物に代わって貨幣で納入する制度。
sen.e: The term Daisenno means the system to pay kuji (public service), nengu (tribute) and/or jishi (land tax) in cash, instead of in kind, that was introduced in medieval Japan at shoen (manor), kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office) and/or bukeryo (territories of samurai family).
